author: Josh Heck
title: USD 259 promotes from within for next superintendent
text: Enlarge Wichita USD 259 has selected its next superintendent. The board of education voted Tuesday to promote from within the district and hire Alicia Thompson as the district’s top leader. The 6-0 decision came during a special meeting Tuesday morning. A contract vote is expected during the next regular meeting of the board, which is scheduled for Feb. 27. With that in place, Thompson will take over for John Allison on July 1. Thompson is the assistant superintendent of elementary schools for USD 259. She is a graduate of Heights High School and has worked with the district for the bulk of her career. Thompson is part of the Wichita Business Journal's 2006 class of 40 Under 40. The hire marks a couple of firsts for USD 259. Thompson will be the district’s first female and first African-American superintendent. Allison, meanwhile, is leaving the district to take over leadership of Olathe USD 233 Josh Heck covers health care, professional services, education and energy. Industries
